title.narrative: Evaluating the Welfare Impacts of a Livestock Transfer Program in Nepal

description.narrative: This project has been designed to serve as research site for the research project entitled ‘Evaluating the Welfare Impacts of a Livestock Transfer Program in Nepal’. This research is funded by USAID Innovation Lab (BASIS Assets and Market Access Innovation Lab, Adapting Livestock Systems to Climate Change Innovation Lab) at the University of California Davis. The research seeks to disentangle the importance of physical (livestock) assets relative to human and social capital in the provision of social protection designed to permanently increased resiliency and improve nutritional and economic outcomes for the persistent poverty in Nepal. There are distinctly two steams of tasks 1.Implementation of the project activities and 2.carry out research work of evaluation of impacts of the project components. Heifer is responsible to implement the project in the selected project area and Montana State University, University of Georgia, International Food Policy and Research Institute, and Nepa School of Social Sciences and Humanities will implement the research component in the respective project areas. The project will implement three separate treatment groups. All sixty wards will be divided into four equal groups (15 ward each) i.e. three treatment and one control groups. The treatment groups will be as follows: Treatment group 1: (full package) Livestock transfer, group savings, human capital, and social capital Treatment group 2: (without physical capital) Group savings, human capital, and social capital Treatment group 3: (without social capital) Livestock transfer, group savings and human capital Treatment group 4: Control
